remarks: The difference of two group sums expressed as mappings with finite domain.  (Contributed by AV, 7-Nov-2019.)
statement:
gsummptfidmsub.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
gsummptfidmsub.s $e |- .- = ( -g ` G ) $.
gsummptfidmsub.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. Abel ) $.
gsummptfidmsub.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. Fin ) $.
gsummptfidmsub.c $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> C e. B ) $.
gsummptfidmsub.d $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> D e. B ) $.
gsummptfidmsub.f $e |- F = ( x e. A |-> C ) $.
gsummptfidmsub.h $e |- H = ( x e. A |-> D ) $.
gsummptfidmsub $p |- ( ph -> ( G gsum ( x e. A |-> ( C .- D ) ) ) = ( ( G gsum F ) .- ( G gsum H ) ) ) $.
$d .- x $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d ph x $.
